name: William Kyle Hamilton
body:
About William Kyle Hamilton
=========

Kyle earned his Bachelor of Arts degree in Psychology with a minor in Political Science from the University of California, Merced in 2012 and is now a volunteer research assistant at the [Health Communications and Interventions Lab]. Kyle serves as a board member for the [UC Merced Alumni Association], as well as a board member for the Merced County Advisory Board on Alcohol and Drug Problems. Kyle currently works at the University of California, Merced as a Lab Assistant III in the School of Natural Science.

CV
-----
My current [CV] can be accessed here


Tutorials
=========

From time to time I am asked to run tutorials for groups, as I produce these I will post them here, feel free to use these as you see fit, if there are any questions, comments, concerns, or fears please contact me.


R Workshops
----------------

**Mechanical Turk and AWS Workshop - December 5th, 2013 at UC Merced**

This workshop was geared towards social science researchers who had never used Amazon Web Services or Mechanical Turk. Topics that were touched on included What is MTurk?, How much should you pay?, Installing MTurkR in RStudio, Accessing your AWS Security Credentials, Messaging Workers thought MTurkR, Sending SMS and Email messages though AWS, and Assigning Qualifications in MTurk. 

**These slides were designed to be used as a reference. ** 

**Mechanical Turk and AWS Workshop - February 3rd, 2014 at UC Merced**

This workshop is almost the same as the workshop I ran in the Fall semester, I added a few details about Turkopticon, the people who run Turkopticon, the author of MTurkR and myself. These files for the workshop are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 United States License and were designed to be used as a reference. 

**These slides were designed to be used as a reference. ** 

R Packages
-----------

Here are a few packages I have authored for R:

* [R73] - Ham Radio Lookup API via R
* [RCryptsy] - Access to information from the Cryptsy Crypto-Currency exchange API via R
* [RSciIpsum] - Access to the Science Ipsum service API via R


[CV]:https://www.dropbox.com/s/oj4qzneao039wnh/WilliamKyleHamiltonCV07102014.pdf
[Health Communications and Interventions Lab]:http://cameronhcilab.org/
[UC Merced Alumni Association]:http://alumni.ucmerced.edu/board
[R73]:https://github.com/kylehamilton/R73
[RCryptsy]:http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RCryptsy/index.html
[RSciIpsum]:https://github.com/kylehamilton
